definition: to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole

sentences.english: First, the heavy burden of personal cost.
But problems within that force have put additional burdens on MONUC.
sentences.chinese: 但是该部队内部的问题加重了MONUC的负担。

sentences.english: Therefore, the translators will translate all the documents the burden of responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 因此，翻译人员将对所有的文件翻译负担责任。

sentences.english: Leukocyte telomere length (LTL) reflects not only chronologic age but also the burden of disease. We hypothesized that LTL would be decreased in children with OSA.
sentences.chinese: 白细胞端粒长度不仅反映年龄变化而且反映疾病负担。

sentences.english: To have governments pay for all education and healthcare expenses can become quite a fiscal burden.
sentences.chinese: 资助个人艺术家可能会成为政府的一大财政负担。

sentences.english: The second is to reform the tax-refund sharing system.
sentences.chinese: 二是要改革出口退税共同负担机制。

sentences.english: The burden is on the developer for resolving these conflicts.
sentences.chinese: 解决这些冲突的负担落在了开发人员身上。

sentences.english: The cost for arbitration shall be borne by the losing party if it is not otherwise ruled by the arbitration authority.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁费除仲裁机关另有裁决外均应由败诉方负担。

sentences.english: This had the side effect of bumping some people into a higher tax bracket.
sentences.chinese: 这在无形之中就增加了人们的税收负担。

sentences.english: However, the reality of leadership involves the heavy burden of responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 然而，事实上，领导承受着沉重的责任负担。

sentences.english: The psychological effects often exacerbate health problems that the physiological stress response has already caused.
sentences.chinese: 心理作用通常加剧了生理负担早已引发的健康问题。

sentences.english: I was about to become the breadwinner for my family and I was 18 years old.
sentences.chinese: 18岁的我将要成为负担家计的男人。

sentences.english: It is a burden on the criminal-justice system.
Students are heavily burdened with home assignments.
sentences.chinese: 学生家庭作业负担过重。

sentences.english: The problem was that the poorer countries couldn't afford them.
sentences.chinese: 以前的问题是贫穷国家没办法负担得起药费。

sentences.english: The schoolwork weighs heavily on the students of traditional Chinese medicine colleges and universities;
sentences.chinese: 中医院校大学生的课业负担较重，生活相对单一。

definition: to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)
heavy load/heavy burden (also fig. of tax)
